qas.question: On what date did the Government of National Defence negotiate an armistice?
With whom did the French government negotiate?
What consequence of war were Parisians suffering?
Which French minister traveled to Versailles to discuss peace?
What was the date on which jFarve and Bismarck met?

context: On <a0_0>28 January 1871<a0_0/> the Government of National Defence based in Paris negotiated an armistice with <a1_0>the Prussians<a1_0/>. With Paris <a2_0>starving<a2_0/>, and Gambetta's provincial armies reeling from one disaster after another, French foreign minister <a3_0>Favre<a3_0/> went to Versailles on <a4_0>24 January<a4_0/> to discuss peace terms with Bismarck. Bismarck agreed to end the siege and allow food convoys to immediately enter Paris (including trains carrying millions of German army rations), on condition that the Government of National Defence surrender several key fortresses outside Paris to the Prussians. Without the forts, the French Army would no longer be able to defend Paris.
